ovdesc.p: This table is user defined and particular to the Securities' Module only.

It allows the user to set up his own codes for each and every transaction within the Securities Module. The ID for each of these transactions is a 1-3 alpha/numeric code which the user sets up when implementing the system initially. Examples of these codes are:-"SPR" for all security purchase type transactions;" DIV" for all Dividend payments etc.
This table is linked to two other tables within the Securities area:-
SC.TRANS.TYPE and Transaction (Which is a table type file in common with all other T24 Modules.

The SC.TRANS.TYPE file takes the transaction name and links it to both a Securities Credit or Debit Indicator and then specifies whether or not that Entry is a financial Credit or Debit (by using a valid transaction code.)

The purpose of these tables is to enable the system to identify the type of transaction being entered and how to post entries. An extra feature is that it allows the user to define and manipulate his own transaction codes.

desc.p: This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the SC.TRANS.NAME in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Short Name is to be entered.
3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input.)
Unique reference which identifies the Sc.Trans.Name
A user defined code for each and every transaction within the Securities Module which are linked to two additional table type files. (i) SC.TRANS.TYPE. (ii) Transactions.
Together they enable the system to process all sorts of transactions correctly.
A Securities Credit and a financial Debit as is the case with a purchase of securities could be given the key SPR.

Examples: A Securities' Trade contains two transaction names for example. A purchase and Sale of Securities. These could be given transaction codes of "SPR" and "SSL" and because they are linked within the SC.TRANS.TYPE table the System knows which way to post the Securities and Financial entries.
1-3 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)
